alert.note: Alert for Cobb; Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 04 at 9:48PM EST until January 05 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Chattahoochee River at Atlanta affecting Cobb and Fulton Counties. Chattahoochee River near Whitesburg affecting Carroll, Coweta and Heard Counties. Suwanee Creek at Suwanee affecting Gwinnett County. Sweetwater Creek near Austell affecting Douglas and Cobb Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Georgia... Chattahoochee River at GA 280 near Atlanta affecting Cobb and Fulton Counties. For the Chattahoochee River Basin...including Helen, Dahlonega, Cornelia, Buford, Buford, Suwanee, Suwanee, Chattahoochee River upstream McGinnis Ferry Rd, Norcross, Chattahoochee River above Roswell, Roswell, Powers Ferry & I285 Atlanta, Smyrna, Chattahoochee River below Morgan Falls Dam, Atlanta, Atlanta, Atlanta, Atlanta, Fairplay, Whitesburg, Fairburn, Whitesburg, Whitesburg, Franklin, Corinth, Hammett Rd below Hogansville, Franklin, West Point, Union, Columbus, Omaha...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Suwanee Creek...including Suwanee...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Sweetwater Creek...including Powder Springs, Powder Springs, Powder Springs, Austell, Austell, Austell, Sweetwater Creek below Austell...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chattahoochee River at Atlanta. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 14 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding begins in the woodlands along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on Paces Ferry Road. Portions of an athletic field at Lovett School...backyards of residential homes on Cochise Drive...Paces Ferry Drive...Paces Manor and Farmington Drive...and walking paths by a restaurant will be under one foot of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 14.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 PM EST Wednesday was 16.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 3.7 feet Monday evening. - Flood stage is 14 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.9 feet on 02/16/1990. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
